content:
In #32769 I am very unsure whether to use junk values or not. Currently, my opinion is that mulLeftCLM should use junk value, but for the old bilinLeftCLM should stay as it is. Reason being that bilinLeftCLM is used also to define pairing and there it is very desirable to have the defeq right. For mulLeftCLM (and the version for tempered distributions) you want to use junk values, because it will involve complicated expressions for treating Fourier multipliers.
It would be nice having some input here.
